posts.post_content:
Disgusting.  
  
For the price, you could play 2 [tome scour](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=tome scour) if the 1 was blue or a [glimpse the unthinkable](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=glimpse the unthinkable) if the 1 was black which will both net you ten milled cards. In addition you can not target your own deck, which was the only justification I could come up with when I saw this card originally before I read "target opponent".  
  
So a limited mill card that once it is out of standard will only be played be people lacking tome scours or glimpse the unthinkables.  
  
This and [searing spear](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=searing spear) are some of my least favorite cards in the deck because they are completely outshone by comaprable cards (from the last bloody core set!) and are just plain standard fodder  
  
Edit: Yeah, I think I was angry about something when I posted this. Ignore this foolishness, it is WRONG
